content: along the co and bobble edges keep stitching around tightening as you go and pushing the co/bobble edge of the fabric towards the inside of the pumpkin for a cleaner look fasten_off tightly to inside of piece cut yarn with tapestry needle still threaded move to the opposite end of the double thick fabric and gather the bottom of the piece with your yarn before cinching the piece closed stuff with polyfil firmly then cinch the bottom closed by weaving in and out of the bottom several times and drawing tightly fasten_off securely but do not cut the yarn with both ends of the tail threaded through the tapestry needle make 5 segments / section tightly with the tail end to make corrugated lines around the pumpkin body fasten_off securely stem by hand color b co 3 sts work i cord for 1 cut yarn and draw through sts fasten to top of pumpkin by machine color b crochet chain 3 sts work i cord have one pushed in for part on carriage for 14 row cut yarn and draw through sts fasten to top of pumpkin finishing abbreviations bobble= bind off bor= beginning of round co= cast on m= marker pm= place marker round= round sl= slip st= 3 stitch st st= stockinette stitch e g this pattern is copyright 2023 please do not copy reproduce or distribute this pattern without written permission a p http //www ravelry com/designers/vanessa-ewing vanessaewingdesign@gmail com weave in all ends abbreviations bobble= bind off bor= beginning of round co= cast on m= marker pm= place marker round= round sl= slip st= 4 stitch st st= stockinette stitch e g this pattern is copyright 2023 please do not copy reproduce or distribute this pattern without written permission a p http //www ravelry com/designers/vanessa-ewing vanessaewingdesign@gmail com
